document.topic_text: 3 Arkansas State students missing in cave have been found THV11 Digital , KTHV 8:24 PM. CDT August 11, 2016 Google Maps INDEPENDENCE COUNTY, Ark. (KTHV) -- Three Arkansas State University students that were reported missing in a cave near Batesville have been found alive. The three are safe and a medical team is checking them for any possible injuries. — Arkansas State (@ArkansasState) August 12, 2016 According to university spokesperson Regina Bowman, the wife of one of the students reported them missing Wednesday evening. She said her husband, a senior at ASU, was leading the group on a spelunking trip in the Batesville cave system in Independence County. The other two students are said to be incoming first-year students from Japan. A search and rescue mission is underway. The names of the three students are: - Casey Sherwood, 25
